semantic_title: Coding Abuse in Pregnant Patients with Proper Sequencing
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Chapter 15: Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > r. Abuse in a pregnant patient

content.full_text: For suspected or confirmed cases of abuse of a pregnant patient, a code(s) from subcategories O9A.3, Physical abuse complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium, O9A.4, Sexual abuse complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium, and O9A.5, Psychological abuse complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium, should be sequenced first, followed by the appropriate codes (if applicable) to identify any associated current injury due to physical abuse, sexual abuse, and the perpetrator of abuse. See Section I.C.19. Adult and child abuse, neglect and other maltreatment. (Evidence: pg no: 71, L58-L61)
content.summary: Abuse codes in pregnant patients use O9A.3, O9A.4, or O9A.5 sequenced first, followed by injury and perpetrator codes. (Evidence: pg no: 71, L58-L61)
key_concepts: Pregnancy-specific abuse codes (Evidence: pg no: 71, L59-L60)
Sequencing priority for abuse codes (Evidence: pg no: 71, L60)
Additional injury and perpetrator coding (Evidence: pg no: 71, L60-L61)
Suspected or confirmed abuse (Evidence: pg no: 71, L58-L59)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Sequence O9A abuse codes first, followed by injury and perpetrator codes (Evidence: pg no: 71, L60-L61)
detailed_rules.explanation: When coding abuse in pregnant patients, the pregnancy-specific abuse codes take priority in sequencing, followed by any associated injury codes and perpetrator identification codes (Evidence: pg no: 71, L60-L61)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify type of abuse (physical, sexual, psychological)
Step 2: Select appropriate O9A subcategory code
Step 4: Add injury codes if applicable
Step 5: Add perpetrator codes if applicable

code_ranges.description: Physical abuse complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium (Evidence: pg no: 71, L59-L60)
code_ranges.requirement: Sequence first for physical abuse cases
usage_rules: Use for suspected or confirmed physical abuse (Evidence: pg no: 71, L58-L59)

code_ranges.description: Sexual abuse complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium (Evidence: pg no: 71, L59-L60)
code_ranges.requirement: Sequence first for sexual abuse cases
usage_rules: Use for suspected or confirmed sexual abuse (Evidence: pg no: 71, L58-L59)

code_ranges.description: Psychological abuse complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium (Evidence: pg no: 71, L59-L60)
code_ranges.requirement: Sequence first for psychological abuse cases
usage_rules: Use for suspected or confirmed psychological abuse (Evidence: pg no: 71, L58-L59)

code_patterns.description: Standard sequencing pattern for pregnancy abuse cases (Evidence: pg no: 71, L60-L61)
code_patterns.example: O9A.3 followed by injury and perpetrator codes
code_patterns.explanation: Pregnancy abuse code takes priority, followed by associated codes

references_to.title: Adult and child abuse, neglect and other maltreatment
references_to.explanation: Referenced for additional guidance on abuse coding (Evidence: pg no: 71, L61)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Pregnant patient presents with injuries from domestic violence
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: 32-week pregnant patient presents with facial bruising and rib contusions from domestic violence by intimate partner.
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify physical abuse during pregnancy
Step 2: Code O9A.3 as primary diagnosis
Step 3: Add injury codes for bruising and contusions
Step 4: Add perpetrator code for intimate partner

correct_coding.sequencing: O9A.3 first, then injury and perpetrator codes
correct_coding.rationale: Pregnancy abuse codes are sequenced first, followed by associated injury and perpetrator codes (Evidence: pg no: 71, L60-L61)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Pregnancy abuse codes must be sequenced first
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Sequencing injury codes before pregnancy abuse codes

warnings: Must sequence O9A codes first before injury or perpetrator codes (Evidence: pg no: 71, L60-L61)
best_practices: Use appropriate O9A subcategory based on abuse type (Evidence: pg no: 71, L59-L60)
Include perpetrator codes when applicable (Evidence: pg no: 71, L60-L61)
common_mistakes: Sequencing injury codes before pregnancy abuse codes
tips: Can be used for both suspected and confirmed abuse cases
implementation_notes: Ensures proper documentation of abuse in pregnancy context
clinical_context: Important for tracking domestic violence during pregnancy
